title: Do real Geisha's still exist. What duties do they carry out? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello! Thanks for requesting an answer from me! Geisha DO still exist! You can find them in Tokyo as well as other cities, but I’ll be speaking about the main Geisha we know today — Kyoto Geisha. It may be a little hard to think about it this way, but being a Geisha is a career. They start out as Shikomi (someone who is learning to wear Kimono and taking lessons) and may even go all the way to a Jimae or Natori Geiko! (A Geisha who lives independently, or a Geisha who is considered a master of dance or music.) They debut and they retire. Geisha are often hired to serve at Ozashiki, or banquets. They are also sometimes called parties. They serve alcohol, chat with customers, play games, and perform songs and dances. This is where they make their money. They may also perform dances! Each Kagai (section of Kyoto that is considered a “Geisha district”) has their own dances and traditions. People from all over flock to see these dances where Maiko (Apprentice Geisha) and Geisha perform! Not only are they working women, but they are often holding up tradition while performing these dances. There are other holidays where you might see a Maiko at a temple handing out lucky bamboo. This happens in the Kagai Gion Kobu and Miyagawa Cho on January 6th! It’s called Hatsu Ebisu! So TLDR; Yes Geisha still exist! They perform dances and sometimes are seen at temples. They also entertain at banquets at a customer’s request. Hopefully, they’ll be around for a while more!

response.answer_text: Of course they still exist. It takes years of very exhausting training to become one. As the word says: she is an artist. She is trained to move, dress, speak and behave graciously. She must master traditional music and dance, Takes time. If you can afford to book one, be prepared for exquisite entertainment during your dinner. She will pour sake, dance and sing traditional style, she may even be able to speak English and you might have an interesting talk. But that’s it.

Yes they do exist, but let me make it straight. None of them are prostitutes. They sit next to you, chat with you, pour you Sake, perfome traditional dance and anything to make you happy except sleep with you.
